medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe, disfiguring, inflammatory dissecting folliculitis of the scalp, hidradenitis suppurativa, and cystic acne.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient exhibited high-frequency sensorineural hearing impairment shortly after birth. At 5 years of age, cystic acne appeared on his face and torso. With the onset of puberty, painful, interconnected, draining abscesses developed on multiple areas including the face, scalp, neck, and torso, leading to numerous hospitalizations for surgical debridement.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic high-frequency sensorineural hearing impairment; recurrent cystic acne; multiple surgical interventions for skin lesions; 4 episodes of clinically suggested pneumonia.
medical_history.family_history: History of cystic acne on the paternal side; no family history of hyperkeratosis, deafness, or severe infections.
